thread.title: H.S. roundup: Montville boys soccer defeats Windham in OT
thread.title_full: H.S. roundup: Montville boys soccer defeats Windham in OT

author: The Bulletin
title: H.S. roundup: Montville boys soccer defeats Windham in OT
text: WILLIMANTIC — Montville’s Lucas Chaude scored the game-tying goal with just seven minutes left in regulation on Monday, then scored the game-winner seven minutes into overtime as the Indians won their second straight boys soccer game, 2-1, over Windham. Ethan Rose assisted on Chaude’s first goal and Nik Strickland made three saves for Montville (8-1-2). Austin Korczynski converted a penalty kick in the 24th minute to put the Whippets (5-4-1) up and Eduardo Garcia made eight saves in the loss. Bacon 2 East Lyme 1 EAST LYME — The Bobcats scored a goal in each half and took sole possession of first place in the Eastern Connecticut Conference Large Division. Tyler Lewis and LJ Luster each scored for Bacon (8-1-2, 5-1), while Nick Wall made six saves. James Foster scored on an assist from Jacob Walsh with two minutes left for the Vikings (9-2, 5-2), who had their eight-game win streak halted. Fitch 2 Killingly 1 (OT) GROTON — Meshama Charles took a pass from Teddy Lee and beat the keeper to the upper right corner just 25 seconds into overtime as the Falcons earned the win. Lee also scored Fitch’s first goal and Greg Cooper made six saves for Fitch (4-7-1). Brendan Turner scored and Luis Mermoza made fives saves for the Redmen (8-3), who had their three-game win streak snapped. Parish Hill 3 Wheeler 0 CHAPLIN — Zach Card scored a pair of second-half goals to lead the Pirates to a nonleague win. Kyle Jacobson scored the game’s first goal and Daniel Beer made 15 saves in the shutput for Parish Hill (5-4-1). The Lions are 1-11. Ledyard 2 St. Bernard 0 LEDYARD — Owen Wheeler scored on an assist from Jack Woodruff midway through the first half to lead the Colonels to their third straight win. AJ Genova scored on a penalty kick, while Isiah McNair made a pair of saves to earn the shutout for Ledyard (3-8). Juan Uran made 11 saves for the Saints (3-8). GIRLS SOCCER Ledyard 5 St. Bernard 1 LEDYARD — Kelly Lamb had two goals and an assist and the Colonels scored five unanswered goals after falling behind early to post their sixth straight win. Alyssa Samson, Alex Natale and Emily Kowalski also scored for Ledyard (8-2). Kara Bassett had a goal for the Saints (5-5-1). Parish Hill 2 Wheeler 1 NORTH STONINGTON — Allison Bourassa scored the game-winning goal midway through the second half and the Pirates earned the nonleague win. Jaida Davis also scored for Parish Hill (7-3). Emma Morgan’s goal accounted for all of the offense for the Lions (2-6), while Kylie Garcia made 11 saves in the loss. Page 2 of 2 - VOLLEYBALL Woodstock 3 Newtown 0 WOODSTOCK — Jacqueline Low had 10 kills and the Centaurs swept the Nighthawks in a nonleague match, 25-15, 25-23, 25-20, for their seventh straight win. Lela Miller added 18 assists and 18 service points for Woodstock (11-3). Wheeler 3 Ledyard 0 NORTH STONINGTON — The Lions handed the Colonels their sixth straight loss in straight sets. Wheeler is 5-8; Ledyard is 1-12. By The Bulletin
